overview: The purpose of this measure is to establish an adjudication system and procedures to process fireworks infractions. [6] This bill also seeks to amend and establish various definitions and penalties for fireworks offenses, including establishing heightened penalties under certain circumstances, and establish various criminal offenses and penalties related to fireworks or articles pyrotechnics. [6] It will also appropriate funds to the Judiciary to implement this measure. [6]
appropriations: The measure includes a provision to appropriate funds to the Judiciary to implement this measure. [6] The provided committee report does not specify an amount for this appropriation. [6]
assumptions_and_methodology: The new legislative documents do not contain specific assumptions or a methodology for calculating financial projections. [6]
agency_impact: Your Committee received testimony in support of this measure from the Department of Law Enforcement and Honolulu Police Department. [6] The Department of the Attorney General provided comments with suggested amendments to clarify permit use and which law enforcement officers may be designated as administrative inspectors. [6] The Office of the Public Defender raised concerns regarding the concurrent trial provision in this measure and asserted that it is the lack of enforcement, rather than the lack or severity of penalties, that has resulted in the low number of charges brought under existing fireworks control laws. [6]
